column1: Pontedera was the seat of several historical battles. In 1369
column2: the Milanese army of Barnabò Visconti
column4: was defeated here by the Florentine troops. On 11 June 1554
column5: Pontedera was the scene of a pyrrhic victory in the last effort by the Republic of Siena to retain its independence
column6: when Piero Strozzi won against the Florentines. Two months later he was decisively defeated at the Battle of Marciano
